info.title: Credentials API
info.description: An API to issue, manage, and verify self-sovereign identity credentials

post.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
Upload an image and return a URL with the static remote location.

get.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
List all available ledger networks.
Some networks are not available based on your subscription.

This endpoint is no longer needed.
Get the latest transaction author agreement and acceptance methods if one is set on the specified network.

put.description:
This endpoint is no longer needed.
Accept the latest transaction author agreement on the specified network.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all connections.
Optionally, list only connections in a specified state.

post.description:
Initiate a new connection by creating an invitation.
The newly created connection record will be in state 'Invited' until the other party has accepted the invitation. 
The response body includes details about the newly creation connection.

get.description: Get the specified connection.

List all credentials that match any specified query parameters.
No query parameters are required, but any provided will filter the results.

post.description: Send a credential offer of the specified credential definition to the specified connection.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The definition and connection to which this offer will be sent

get.description: Get the specified credential.

put.description:
Issue the specified credential.
If the values offered were incorrect, changes to the values may be made here.
You must update all of the values, and they must be follow the same structure of the schema.
To keep the values the same as those included in the credential offer, leave the body blank.

delete.description:
Revoke credential that was issued previously.
Process of revocation will update the revocation registry locally and on the ledger.
Issued credentials can still participate in proof workflows and be considered valid, but only if the verifying ignores the revocation trail.

Delete the specified credential.
This endpoint does not revoke the credential.

get.description: List all verification policies for the authenticated organization.

post.description: Create a verification policy from the specified parameters.

get.description: Get the specified verification policy.
List all credential definitions for the authorization context.

post.summary: Create credential definition and schema from parameters
post.description: A credential definition is created and saved on your cloud agent.

get.description: Get the specified credential definition.

post.description: Create a credential definition from the specified schema.

Register schema with the current agency tenant and write the schema to the ledger using the tenant as issuer.
This does not create credential definition.

get.description: List all schemas registered to or used by the authenticated organization.

Please use Verification Policies endpoints.
Get the specified verification definition.

Please use Verification Policies endpoints.
List all verification definitions for the authenticated organization.

post.description:
Please use Verification Policies endpoints.
A verification definition is created and saved on your cloud agent.
You can discover your definition based on the ID that is returned or the name.

delete.description:
Please use Verification Policies endpoints.
Delete the specified verification definition.

post.description: Send a message from the specified message parameters.

get.description: List all messages for the specified connection.
Get the details for the specified message.

Please use the Provider API instead.
List all tenants for the current authorization context.

post.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
Create a new tenant and setup a unique agency endpoint.
The agency will be set as an issuer.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Configuration options for creating new tenant

get.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
Get the configuration for the specified tenant.

delete.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
Permanently remove the specified tenant, including their wallet, endpoint registrations and all data.
All definitions, connections and credentials issued will be deleted.
This action cannot be reverted.

get.summary: [Deprecated] Get issuer status for current tenant
get.description:
Please use the Provider API instead.
If the tenant is configured with Dedicated endorsement, this action will check if the issuer DID has the required ENDORSER role on the configured ledger network.
Additionally, check the acceptance of the transaction author agreement and return the text and version if acceptance is required.

put.summary: Send verification to connection from policy
put.description: Send a verification to the specified connection using an existing policy.

post.summary: Send verification to connection from parameters
post.description: Send a verification request to the specified connection from a set of parameters.

put.description: Create a verification from the specified policy and send it to the specified connection.

Create a connectionless verification from the specified policy.
Connectionless transport uses URLs that can be shared with the user over any existing transport (email, SMS, web).

post.description:
Create verification from parameters.
Connectionless transport uses URLs that can be shared with the user over any existing transport (email, SMS, web).

get.description:
List all verifications.
Optionally filter by connection and/or definition.

post.description:
Please use SendVerification(policyId) or CreateVerification(policyId) instead.
This endpoint can be used to send a verification definition to a connection, which will create a verification ID to track the response from the connection.
If the parameter {connectionId} is not specified, this endpoint will create a connectionless verification. A URL will be generated that can be shared with anonymous user.

get.description: Get the specified verification.

This action is now obsolete. Verifications are automatically verified when they are received.
Execute verification on this record. This is an expensive action and is executed by verifying the proof against the ledger data.
List all webhooks registered with the authenticated organization.

post.description: Register a webhook with the authenticated organization.

delete.description: Remove a registered webhook from the authenticated organization.

put.description: Enable a registered webhook for the authenticated organization.
Enable a registered webhook for the authenticated organization.

get.description: Check the health of the API.

connectionId.description: Unique connection identifier. If not specified, a random one will be generated.

multiParty.description:
If set to 'true', the invitation can be used by multiple parties and will always have the status set to 'Invited'.
When a party accepts this invitation, a new connection record with a unique identifier will be created.
Default value is 'false'.

name.description:
Name that can be used as an alias for the connection.
Default value is 'null'.

connectionId.description:
Connection identifier to send this credential to.
If omitted, the request will be treated as connectionless issuance and will generate a URL.

automaticIssuance.description:
If true, the credential will automatically be issued once the individual accepts the offer.
If false, when an individual accepts the offer the credential will be in state 'Requested' and must be manually issued.
Default value is 'false'.

credentialValues.description:
Credential attribute values.
If using connectionless issuance, these attributes must be specified.
Must match all credential definition attribute names.

CredentialDefinitionFromSchemaParameters.description: Represents a request object to create new credential definition for an agency

tag.description: Unique tag to differentiate definitions of the same schema
Unique tag to differentiate definitions of the same schema

issuerKeyGenerationSeed.description: Issuer key generation seed used for deterministic key creation (32 characters)

agentKeyGenerationSeed.description: Agent key generation seed used for deterministic key creation (32 characters)

requireAcceptance.description: Indicates if user needs to accept the latest agreement on the network

issuerCanEndorse.description: Indicates if the user has Endorser status

valid.description: True if verification passed, otherwise False

oauth2.name: Authorization
oauth2.description: Standard Authorization header using the Bearer scheme and an Access Token. Example: "Bearer {Access Token}"
